description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3bccv","text":"Automated detection of gut Lewy Pathology using Leica Bond RX processor based on Protocol F using Bond Polymer Refine Detection kit (Leica Biosystems, Cat#: DS9800). Adapted from \"Method 5\" as described in Beach TG et al., J Parkinsons Dis. 2016.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vf73","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9a15g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vcc1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmjuj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dl534","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qg3a","text":"Acknowledgments","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3e5a","text":"We are grateful to the Banner Sun Health Research Institute Brain and Body Donation Program of Sun City, Arizona, for the provision of human colon tissue and data. The Brain and Body Donation Program is supported by the National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke (U24 NS072026 National Brain and Tissue Resource for Parkinsons Disease and Related Disorders), the National Institute on Aging (P30 AG19610 Arizona Alzheimers Disease Core Center), the Arizona Department of Health Services (contract 211002, Arizona Alzheimers Research Center), the Arizona Biomedical Research Commission (contracts 4001, 0011, 05-901 and 1001 to the Arizona Parkinsons Disease Consortium) and the Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinsons Research. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c1mqb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ephlq","text":"We wish to acknowledge Yunfeng Li and the Translational Pathology Core Laboratory (TPCL) at UCLA for assistance with tissue processing, IHC staining, and scanning.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"align":"","authors":"Beach TG, Corbillé AG, Letournel F, Kordower JH, Kremer T, Munoz DG, Intorcia A, Hentz J, Adler CH, Sue LI, Walker J, Serrano G, Derkinderen P","can_edit":true,"created_on":"","date":1476835200,"doi":"https://doi.org/","guid":"22318231B84B4B6DB135EAE860BD9D8E","id":0,"journal":"","protocol_guid":"","protocol_id":0,"title":"Multicenter Assessment of Immunohistochemical Methods for Pathological Alpha-Synuclein in Sigmoid Colon of Autopsied Parkinson's Disease and Control Subjects."}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"alt":"","guid":"EB438A2A657911EFB4CC0A58A9FEAC02","height":345,"id":495524,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"bojn4\",\"text\":\"a. Adjacent sections from a healthy control stained for phosphorylated α-Syn (MJFR-13, abcam ab168381) are shown with (left) and without (right) proteinase K treatment demonstrating robust detection of insoluble LP. b. Higher power view of Lewy Pathology (solid arrow) in a PD myenteric plexus ganglion. Samples obtained from Banner Health Brain and Body Donation Program.
